Instrument.name: MINI-RF FORERUNNER for CH1-ORB
Instrument.description: The Miniature Synthetic Aperture Radar (Mini-SAR) is a small imaging radar designed primarily to map the scattering properties of the lunar poles in order to ascertain if water ice is present and if so, to determine its location and distribution. Concentrated ice exhibits an increase in radar reflectivity and enhancement of circular polarization ratio along the backscatter direction which can be measured by Mini-SAR, allowing construction of a map of the location of ice deposits. Mini-SAR will also be used to produce radar maps of the lunar surface near the poles.
